channel.title: Rainmeter
channel.description:
Anyone good with it?
Where do you start if you want to do... anything custom at all...
That "manual?" Some third party site?

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
It’s only showing the temperature for one core, and I have SpeedFan running and everything. Not sure if it’s the skin or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Alright I didn’t notice a problem this time when 10PM rolled around, but I think I might have refreshed before actually looking.

Also, “temperature” seems like a vague variable. Can the value it gives be split up into separate parts (i.e., GPU, CPU…) or is it nothing more than a temperature of inside your computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
You would have to use one of the rainmeter plugins like speed fan. https://rainmeter.net/RainCMS/?q=SpeedFan

as for the clipping try removing the w value as you don’t need it in your setup as well. I just defined it because i needed it centered on the screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
It’s not centered though, all my strings are left aligned.

EDIT: Also, any ideas on how to grab the temperature of the computer for Rainmeter? A skin someone else made that I could modify would be fine, too.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
WTF swear I responded to this thread, internet must have timed out.

The reason it is happening is The x value is too small and the text is centered. As for fixing the config, the way you are using it, I would right align the text and set the x value to some smaller number.

For shadows I just did as sersoft said, in the origional config there is [MonthMeater] [MonthmeterS] s=shadow, Same meter just down 2 px darker and less opasity.

With images you can do more intricate shadows and reflections but this is normally limited to just numbers as each symbol (1,2,3,4,a,b,c,d) must be rendered. Also when displaying the information you have to split the output into a config for each character. So to display the number 135 you would need 3 image configs.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Medevilae:

This is what I’ve customized it to so far. Got a different weather skin.

Every time it gets to 10, AM or PM, half the M gets cut off. Is there a way I can prevent that? I didn’t see anything in the skin file that would do something like that.

That question still needs answered.

Also, any advice on how to make a shadow in a skin file, that I could put behind the RSS feeds?

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
CTID:

For each config, check “Keep on screen.”

EDIT: Also, if you want it to stay on the desktop, go to each config’s “Position” setting and check “On Desktop.”

That worked.

Now…
When I try to set up my weather, I put in my location code, (USPA16691) but it doesn’t work? It’s not even working with the default values! Something’s up with the cfg I’m guessing.

Variables
;Please replace your location code of Weather.com below, e.g: Taipei is TWXX0021.
;You can check it on Weather.com or Google.
;And you may also delete “&unit=m” if you prefer the Fahrenheit Scale.
URL=https://xoap.weather.com/weather/local/USWI0723?cc=*&dayf=6
Font=Trebuchet MS

EDIT: Also FireTime, I didn’t disregard what you said about being in the Steam chat, but my Steam account has been disabled until hell knows when…

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
For each config, check “Keep on screen.”

EDIT: Also, if you want it to stay on the desktop, go to each config’s “Position” setting and check “On Desktop.”

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Awesome. Thanks man!

EDIT: How can I prevent show desktop from minimizing Rainmeter stuff?

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
BAM

https://pastebin.com/QEP5JHXh

Thats the code For the week day,time,Date, and month. I commented on what most of the function do. If you want to run it save it as an ini file (blah.ini) in the directory:

%USERPROFILE%\Documents\Rainmeter\Skins\BLAH

Requires two fonts (to make it look nice) have themsaved here.

once you do that restart rainmeter and right clock on the taskbar icon, go to configs blah/Blah.ini

If you have any questions about it post em or I’m usually logged into steam chat.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
I’m still building them as I just recently finished the hardware. I’ll post em up as I finish them. Also an FYI the visible part of thst template in the screen shot will most likely be 5 configs:

  1. Day/Time
  2. Weather
  3. Calendar Events
  4. E-mail
  5. Month/Date

item.title: Rainmeter
item.dc:creator: Saint_Zvlkx
item.description:
FireTime:

Whats the fun in that? It;s may more satisfying knowing that you have a one of a kind system that you created. Plus you can make it exactly the way you want it, not the way some other person does.

Some of us want a simple and efficient desktop replacement and don’t have time to learn a whole new system just to set something up ourselves. It’s the reason so many people don’t use Linux.

Read full topic
